    • Method Detail

      • processEntry

        public static void processEntry(Metacard metacard,
                                String operation,
                                org.osgi.service.event.EventAdmin eventAdmin)
        Processes an entry by adding properties from the metacard to the event. Then the eventAdmin is used to post the metacard properties as a single event.
        Parameters:
        metacard - - the metacard to process
        operation - - The type of event PubSubConstants
        eventAdmin - - OSGi EventAdmin service used post events

      • handleEvent

        public void handleEvent(org.osgi.service.event.Event event)
        By default the Felix EventAdmin implementation has a timeout of 5000 ms. Your event handler has to return from the handle event method in this time frame. If it does not, it gets Blacklisted. Therefore, this method processes its events in a separate thread than the EventAdmin who called it.
        Specified by:
        handleEvent in interface org.osgi.service.event.EventHandler

      • createSubscription

        public String createSubscription(Subscription subscription)
                          throws InvalidSubscriptionException
        Description copied from interface: EventProcessor
        Create a Subscription with an automatically-generated id.
        Specified by:
        createSubscription in interface EventProcessor
        Parameters:
        subscription - the Subscription to register
        Returns:
        String an id for the registered Subscription that can be used later by calling #unsubscribe(String)
        Throws:
        InvalidSubscriptionException - if this EventProcessor can not support the Filter of the provided Subscription.
        See Also:
        EventProcessor.createSubscription(Subscription, String)

      • createSubscription

        public void createSubscription(Subscription subscription,
                               String subscriptionId)
                        throws InvalidSubscriptionException,
                               SubscriptionExistsException
        Description copied from interface: EventProcessor
        Register a Subscription with this CatalogFramework.

        Note: Subscriptions are transient, not durable, i.e., only maintained in memory and will be lost if DDF is shutdown.
        Durability must be implemented by the client bundle (typically an endpoint - refer to DurableSubscription for an example).

        Note: A Subscription can also be registered using the whiteboard model:
        To register a Subscription via the whiteboard model, simply register any implementation of Subscription with OSGi registry under the interface Subscription. To unregister the Subscription, simply unregister the service that was originally registered. Subscriptions registered in this manner do not get a subscription id and cannot be unsubscribed via the EventProcessor

        Implementations of this method must call the PreSubscriptionPlugin.process(Subscription) method for each
        Specified by:
        createSubscription in interface EventProcessor
        Parameters:
        subscription - the Subscription to register
        subscriptionId - the desired id
        Throws:
        InvalidSubscriptionException - if this EventProcessor can not support the Filter of the provided Subscription.
        SubscriptionExistsException - if a subscription with this ID already exists

      • createFinalPredicate

      • notifyCreated

        public void notifyCreated(Metacard newMetacard)
        Description copied from interface: EventProcessor
        Notify this EventProcessor that a Metacard (or equivalent) has been created in a RemoteSource.

        Implementations of this method must:

        1. Call the PreDeliveryPlugin.processCreate(Metacard) method for all of the registered PreDeliveryPlugins
        2. Call the DeliveryMethod.created(Metacard) method of the DeliveryMethod of matching Subscriptions with the new Metacard created.

        Specified by:
        notifyCreated in interface EventProcessor
        Parameters:
        newMetacard - the newly created Metacard
        See Also:
        RemoteSource, FederatedSource, ConnectedSource

      • notifyUpdated

        public void notifyUpdated(Metacard newMetacard,
                          Metacard oldMetacard)
        Description copied from interface: EventProcessor
        Notify this EventProcessor that a Metacard (or equivalent) has been updated in a RemoteSource.

        Implementations of this method must:

        1. Call PreDeliveryPlugin.processUpdateHit(ddf.catalog.operation.Update) method of all registered PreDeliveryPlugins when a Metacard has been updated and the new version matches a Subscription
        2. Call PreDeliveryPlugin.processUpdateMiss(ddf.catalog.operation.Update) method of all registered PreDeliveryPlugins when a Metacard has been updated and the new version matches a Subscription but the old version does not
        3. Call all registered implementations of DeliveryMethod with the updated Metacard.

        Specified by:
        notifyUpdated in interface EventProcessor
        Parameters:
        newMetacard - the new version of the Metacard
        oldMetacard - the previous version of the Metacard (optional, pass null if not relevant)
        See Also:
        FederatedSource, RemoteSource, ConnectedSource

      • notifyDeleted

        public void notifyDeleted(Metacard oldMetacard)
        Description copied from interface: EventProcessor
        Notify this EventProcessor that a Metacard (or equivalent) has been deleted in a RemoteSource.

        Implementations of this method must:

      • If possible (that is, the Metacard is fully populated) call all active matching Subscriptions associated DeliveryMethod.deleted(Metacard) with the Metacard that was deleted.
      • If impossible (this is, the Metacard only has Metacard.getId(), call all active Subscriptions.

Specified by:
notifyDeleted in interface EventProcessor
Parameters:
oldMetacard - the deleted Metacard
See Also:
RemoteSource, FederatedSource, ConnectedSource
